Comments_List: I learned about fashion design and the evolution of trends.

Learned the whole process of designing a theater costume from portrait gallery, character breakdowns, costume plot researches, garment selection to costume sketching and coloring. I have learned a lot from this course and enjoyed throughout the whole journey.

I learned a more streamlined process for design, in this case costume design, but I feel like I can definitely apply some of the strategies we learned to other areas of design.  I learned a little history about clothing, especially from the 19th century.
Professor Ford did an excellent job guiding us in how to better our artwork and pay attention to details.

Strengths: Jessica is an amazing professor
weakness: I wish the length of the course is longer

I think all the benchmarks that were set during the semester helped me to stay on top of the work, and there were some great exercises we did during class that helped me improve rendering designs.  I wish we spent a little more time going over some of the terms for the costumes, somethings went straight over my head when we talked about them.
Absolutely. This course is highly enjoyable and rewarding.  This course was demanding in workload, but the work was enjoyable and fun.
Absolutely, sketching and coloring for projects were a very enjoyable experiences

Everyone who cares about theatre should take this course.  You gain a real appreciation for costume designers and all the thought that goes into the work.  You also feel more connected to the texts and characters since you will have to make choices in your designs that are not necessarily implied on the page.  It was an interesting challenge to give personality to characters that were underwritten.
